comment: Attendance was not required. Five tests and one gets dropped. All tests were online and open notes.
This class is some kind of joke, but its easy A if you do the pretest.
He just hands you an A and moves on with his life.
He drops one of your lowest test grades, and gives out extra credit for attendance!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The test are exactly like the pretest and he drops your lowest test grade!!
This class is the easiest math course at KSU!! I have never took Calculus in highschool and made A in the class!
He allows you to use your notes on the test !!!

Took his online class. Homework wasn't graded online so the grade was primarily test based. He sent out a document every class day explaining the content and assigned problems in the textbook. They aren't too hard to follow along. Pretests were pretty much the test with different numbers. Tests were open everything. Always check test answer key!!!!

Professor Wu is the best professor I've had at KSU. Tests are similar to study guide and tests are multiple choice with only 3 answer choices !!! It gets even better folks, all tests are OPEN NOTES, including the final exam ! he wants you to pass and cares about your grade. Only checks attendance once throughout the semester(oct 9 for me) Take him!

Professor Wu wants you to pass. He gives extra credit, open note exam with a pretest very similar to the exam. You have all semester to do your homework which definitely helps boost your grade. Overall good guy.

If you want to actually learn anything do not take him. But if you want to cheat your way threw it do so. This professor literally watched students cheat on his tests and turned the blind eye. Mostly because he knows he can't teach. He just hands you an A and moves on with his life. Always walks into class looking depressed.

his class is easy if you show up and listen. attendance is not mandatory. homework every night but he posts all answers and work on d2l. tests are 10 questions and all open note. he gives pre-tests before each test which are similar to the test. he has an accent that is hard to understand if you're not paying 100% attention.

You have 5 tests and a final and one random attendance check. He gives you study guides for each test that are the same kind of problems, and all tests, even the final, are open notes. Super easy class I would at least go to get the main info like equations and what not, but easy. The attendance check was pretty late in the semester but who knows.

All there is are 5 unit tests, a final, and homework in this class. All tests have a pre-test that is almost identical to the test. All homework is posted online is just a completion grade. Does an attendance check one day out of the year worth 5 points. Easiest math class ever.

The tests were open note and open book, AND we did an identical pretest before each test. The lectures are hard to follow though. He only gave one attendance check all semester, and all you had to do was sign in. Answers questions as concisely as possible, and reviews everything a bunch.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof Wu is the man!!!!! Literally if you want to feel good about yourself in a math class for the first time ever, take Prof Wu! A ton of HW but not due until last day of class. Exams are 10 Q multiple choice, nearly identical to pretest. Exams are open book/notes. He's a good dude, wants you to pass. 10/10 would take again. It's that easy!!

Calculus is what you would assume it to be. Professor Wu honestly just wants you to pass. Open note tests, bonus points if you participate, HW thats due at the end of the semester. Tests are literally the same as the review he gives you, just with different numbers. Easy A if you take good notes.

Professor Wu seems to be a great guy and an overall nice person. However, I was not fond of his teaching style. He skips steps when working out problems on the board and tends to mess up when doing his work which can be really confusing. Also, he does the work on the board very fast. It's very hard to keep up with when you are trying to take notes.
If you want a easy A take this class. Never go to class and get 100 on every test. He gives pre tests that are the same as the test and the tests are open book so you can bring the pre test.

He give much more homework than other professors.  If you mess up one test, it will mess up your entire GPA.  I had a tutor and struggled to make a C.  Hard to understtand him also.  There are much better professors.  Class average on 1st test was a D.  Need I say more
don't ever miss this class or you will fail.  attendance mandatry.   no extra credit/no curving of tests.  super difficult
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: THis professor gives long lectures  with an incredible amount of homework.  4 tests that are extremely difficult along with pop quizzes for attendance grades.  Avoid like the plague.
Sky one class and you definitely will not passs.  The connect math is difficult and makes you want to pull your hair out.  The homework takes hours to do.  Challenging tests with no partial credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He takes attendance and the homework is quite tedious.  HW takes about 3 hours a week in addition to studyingg.  Tests are hard with no curve  GPA dropper.  I do not recommend him.

Take attendance.  Homework is unbelievable.  You will work 10 hours a week on homework and still be confused.  I'm good at math, but I barely passed this class.  There are much better professors.  Stay far away

He is a great professor! He gives out extra credit for participation that go towards the final and you are allowed to use your notes on every exam. He makes sure that everyone understands the material and is always willing to answer any questions.
Take this professor!! There is a language barrier but he lets you use notes on all tests including the final.  If you  participate in class you can earn bonus points to use on the final.

This guy is hard to understand but SUCH and easy A. He literally does a review of the exact test (with different numbers) the day before the exam. He does a random attendance check throughout the year which is a solid portion of your grade. He also gives out homework but it isn't due until the end of the semester. 10/10 I would take him again.

This class is super easy especially if you are not good at math. His test are 10 questions with pre-test that are very similar to the test. He takes attendance once randomly throughout the semester that is worth 5% of your grade. He does give a lot of homework but provides the answers to the problems that are turned in for a grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you're not in greek life, this class would be pretty hard.

Very poor communicator in the English language. He doesn't understand student questions and provides clouded feedback. Doesn't use book at all. Grades very few question tests in front of class and verbally embarrasses students. He should not be allowed to teach.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Open book and notes on your tests/exams. He does random attendance check. If you participate in class (going up to the board), you can get extra credit. Do the review tests/exams that he lets you at the beginning of the class, then goes over on how to solve them. The reviews are almost exactly like the tests/exams, except the numbers are different.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved this professor. He made sure we understood everything and made the tests really easy. If you take notes it's an easy A. However, there was a language barrier so most of the time when people asked a question in class it took him a while to understand what was being asked.

Professor Wu is such a good teacher. I am horrible at Math and he made it to where I understood it. There's always a review and all of his test are open book/notes, also he responds to emails within an appropriate amount of time. I highly recommend him and even though I didn't get an A(got a B) I would definitely take him again.

IF YOU THINK YOU'RE NOT A MATH PERSON AND YOU'RE SCARED OF THIS CLASS TAKE HIM. OPEN NOTE TESTS AND PRE TEST Tests. He is hard to understand but no my math lab and 5 tests and he drops one. All tests open notes even final. Take him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He is a really nice guy. He reviews with a practice test the class before each exam which has the same problems on the test with variation of the numbers. Exams -10 q's. Only down side to him is that he can be hard to understand at times because of his accent. If you show up to class and take notes, you will make an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy A. show up to class and take notes and you will get at least a B. Easy tests, exactly the same as practice tests. All tests are open book ad notes and he drops 2 out of 5 tests. Take him for easy A.

Professor Wu was a good teacher, but there definitely was a language barrier. If you go to class and take notes you will be fine. Tests are all open note. The only thing I did not like is that he did not post grades, so no one really knew what they had in the class.

Accent is irrelevant since he explains the concepts very well. Doesn't even use MML or follow the book; posts homework&answers all on d2l, DON'T BUY BOOK OR CODE. Must go to lectures to know what's on tests. Pretests&extra points on final each time you solve a problem on the board. Minimal work. If you think you suck at math, definitely take him!

Easy A. Just show up to class and take notes and you will get at least a B. Easy tests, exactly the same as practice tests he gives class before. All tests are open book ad notes, soooo easy. plus he drops 2 out of 5 tests. He is very nice and always there for you o explain, he wants everyone to get a good grade. Take him for easy A.

He is very helpful on everything. He can keep a little hard to understand but makes sure to write everything down so you understand what he is teaching. Tests are open everything and homework isn't due till the final exam. Go to class and take notes, you'll pass; get someone else's notes, you'll pass. He wants success you just have to respect him.

I can't complaint about his accent because I have one too! You really have to try hard in order to get a failing grade in this class. He's an excellent professor regardless of his accent and makes the class super easy!!
EASY A! just show up to the class and write down the examples, use notes and hw in tests you will pass! didn't need to study anything

BEST TEACHER I'VE EVER HAD. He explains everything so clearly and writes out all the steps. As long as you go to class and get the notes you will get A's on every test, easily (because they're all open notebook). He also gives you the answers to homework before you turn it in so you can just copy it and get a 100 on all of them.

He class is very easy. Just show up and put in an effort and you will do well. He can be difficult to understand due to his accent, but he knows his math and tries very hard to overcome the language barrier. Tests are open notebook and pretty easy. This is a pretty basic Calc class, no reason not to get an A in it.

He does everything in his power to ensure that you pass. His tests are only 15 questions and can be somewhat challenging but you can ask him questions during them and he will help you solve them and also use your notes too. All HW answerssteps are posted online. 1 Optional test retake to replace a low score. Use HW on the TESTS it will help!!!

His class is easy. You are not required to go to class, but the lectures were very useful. He was difficult to understand at times due to his accent, but he is very willing to help. Every test is open note, and he allows you to re-take on exam. Go to class do the HW, and should be easy A.

Professor Wu's tests are all open book and open note. He posts the homework and how to do the problems on D2l. I found him to be very helpful, even during the tests. Definitely refer to your homework problems when taking the test, they'll help a lot. He gives some extra credit and even allows a retake test to replace your lowest grade. I made an A.
Easy A. You can use notes on the test, He posts the homework answers online, can't even complain about his accent because he gives you everything you need to pass. I didn't even buy the book.

Professor Wu is a very fair instructor. He lets you use your notes on the exams, tells you exactly what will be on them, and gives you everything that you need to succeed in the class. Even though the subject matter is very difficult, there are no surprises on the exams. Just come to class every day, take notes, and pay attention.
ok, the only bad thing about this guy is the fact that he is hard to understand. Other than that, easy A. He lets you use your notes on all of the tests.... no way to fail. Def. recommend.

He speaks very broken English and is very hard to understand at times. Doesn't understand your questions. For example, prior to the final I asked him about grades and he told me if I made a 100 on the final I could make an 87 in the class. Just looked at posted grades... I made an A. So. If you're comfortable teaching yourself math - go for it.

He was a great professor that really wants you to understand the material. He works with you on homework and all of the tests are open note. He is harder to understand but he knows this and repeats himself to make sure everyone understands. Just go to class and do your homework and you will do fine.

I took this class as a review to get back into the move of math after high school so it was easy. He's s a nice man but a useless professor. The only reason to go to class is to get the notes for all of his open note exams. You don't even have to go because the book is easier to understand. We had to ask questions repeatedly just so he'd understand
